Description: Wall sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery krater or dinos; interior has heavy wheel marks, reserved; exterior, cream slip: animal frieze at centre between bands with superimposed added white and red bands; lion facing left with paw on neck of bull facing right; red on lion’s mane and paw and bull’s horn; filling ornaments; above, minimal part of upper frieze; below, maeander band.
Curator's comments: The piece has been associated with 1888,0601.539a-c and e, but there is little to comfort the idea.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1178)
